X.iv.1.D.1.e
.
Alcoholism Due to Personality Disorders
Do not consider personality disorders characterized by developmental defects or pathological trends in the personality structure as underlying psychiatric diseases for the purpose of secondaryÂ SC in compensation claims.
Alcoholism due to personality disorders
may not be the basis for granting or increasing disability compensation, but
may be the basis for a rating of incompetency.
title: M21-1, Part X, Subpart iv, Chapter 1, Section D  - Disability  or Death from Use of Alcohol, Drugs, or Tobacco Products
citation: Part X, Subpart iv, Chapter 1, Section D
